derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from Greek kinētikos, from kinein 'to move'

entry.def: In physics, kinetic is used to describe something that is concerned with movement.

means.word_mean: 1. relating to the motion of material bodies and the forces associated therewith;

sentences.sentence: "modern dance has been called kinetic pantomime"
"the complex civilization of which Rome was the kinetic center"- H.O.Taylor
